content.description:
Julia Thought She Freed Someone

Sed mihi manifestusmanifestus, -a, -um, adj.: obvious, apparent errorerror, -oris, m.: mistake videtur, igiturque puto nobis, 
quasi scripserit Iulia, faciendum, quod ipsa scripsisse 
se credidit. Moretur ergo in libertate praesidio nostro
quasi omnia diligentissime caverit.
content.question: In accordance with standard Roman practice, why would Julia have been able to grant someone freedom in her will?

choices.label: Enslaved people were considered property until freed.
As paterfamilias, she had the right to free enslaved people within her family.
Enslaved people were entitled to manumission upon their master’s death.
Because she was a patron, Julia had this right.

content.answer: Enslaved people were considered property until freed.
